Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Greatness \Great"ness\, n. [AS. gre['a]tnes.] 1. The state, condition, or quality of being great; as, greatness of size, greatness of mind, power, etc. [1913 Webster]
2. Pride; haughtiness. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
It is not of pride or greatness that he cometh not aboard your ships. --Bacon. [1913 Webster]

greatness n 1: the property possessed by something or someone of outstanding importance 2: unusual largeness in size or extent [syn: {enormousness}, {grandness}, {immenseness}, {immensity}, {sizeableness}, {vastness}]
